Remember when Overwatch 2 used to be good?
Yeah, me neither.

With the release of overwatch 2, the game turned into a pure cash-grab. Most of the stuff promised to release with overwatch 2 didn't make it into the game on it's release, not even half a year later. (New and promised PVE coop mode, with reworked heroes and mid-game upgradeable skills, including a skill tree)
However, things like battle-pass, new skins, paid currency, more microtransactions really came with the game's release, including broken promises.

I must say, overwatch 1 was a fine game, played it since 2018 and it was a decent shooter, it got really boring overtime, especially in comps with all the sweaty try-hards, but I feel like that was just a skill issue. Launch of overwatch 2 was a disaster, lots of the things they promised didn't really make it into the game but all the stuff that made them money was for some reason included even before the release of OW2, like the pre-order and other editions including battle pass and premium currency, however.. It was still fun, maybe it was because i didn't play overwatch for around half a year before the release of OW2, but when it released I was having a blast. Some heroes got reworked, in general HP, shields and other stuff like passive DMG boosts and HP depending on the hero you played. It was fun, until (it wasn't) they decided to ruin the game yet again with updates changing heroes that didn't really need to be changed and instead of adding promised stuff they added pointless events with skins and worked on new battle passes. As of now, I believe the game can still be fun for alot of people and compared to other games the microtransactions aren't really a big deal but it's just sad seeing what they did with the game. Not even mentioning how 2020 limited-time esport skins (for premium currency) came back into the game for who knows why.
I'll miss flexing with my 2020 Atlantic ALL-STARS Reinhardt skin, it used to be special, now.. almost everyone has it :(

BTW, don't buy the DLCs for OW2, they're overpriced skin garbage.

當初拿來宣傳OW2還展示天賦樹畫面，現在都拿掉很不合理吧，這樣不就打臉自己所承諾的PVE，有些玩家會繼續玩支持買通行證，就是相信他會出PVE有天賦樹，而不是閹割版的劇情活動好嗎？

根據Gamespot的採訪，早在一年半前遊戲總監Aaron Keller就知道沒有要做PVE，而且要一個離職的JEFF背鍋，接任的人這幾年間都不做事嗎，現在都過多久才說不做技能樹沒有英雄升級，怎麼看都很不合理。
有些人會說我沒差我玩PVP，但有沒有想過如果PVE如期做出來一定會再帶起一波人潮，PVP玩家會變多遊戲體驗也會變得更好，希望台灣玩家能多看看國外論壇Reddit或暴雪交流論壇

首先，負評参上

我不想長篇大論，直接先說結論：理由就是暴雪沒有遵守原先承諾的PvE模式（指的是天賦樹等具有角色扮演成長的元素）

確實，暴雪在周邊美術方面做得非常出色，單就Ｏverwatch來講，畫面和人設都非常好看、時常被調侃為本業的短篇動畫每部都超精彩、音樂引人入勝，還有世界觀劇情的輪廓也成功地吊住我的胃口

然而，這都不足以彌補最關鍵的遊戲本身：糟糕的平衡改動、莫名其妙的配對系統、進入2代開始一堆奇怪的bug（喔對，昨天開上去玩，霧子的順步bug過了好幾個月竟然還是沒修好，bruh～）

最後一句感想總結：淦你Bobby Kotick
